Overview.Summary: The Grenfell Tower fire (6, 9, 10) occurred on June 14 in North Kensington, London (10). The number of deaths has been difficult to determine due to the severity of the fire (1,2). The fire has led to discussions about building regulations in the United Kingdom (1). The United States has continued to sell arms to the Kingdom, but this has been met with some criticism (8).

Timeline.Text: At least six people confirmed dead in a massive fire at the Grenfell Tower in North Kensington, London.
A UFO is spotted flying over the Grenfell Tower fire in London. Witnesses share their accounts and footage online.
Reuters reports that the death toll of the Grenfell Tower fire has risen to 17, with many victims yet to be identified.
Explore Trending News reports that the cladding on Grenfell Tower had been banned in the United Kingdom.
The fire at Grenfell Tower continues to spark conspiracy theories, with some claiming to have spotted a UFO flying near the tower during the blaze.
Following the Grenfell Tower fire, Communities Secretary Sajid Javid writes a letter to local authorities addressing fire safety in high-rise buildings.
Theresa May and Justin Trudeau of Canada discuss regional issues in a phone call following the Grenfell Tower fire.

Overview.Summary: The Grenfell Tower fire in London has sparked national news coverage and has been described as a "tudno" moment (1). The fire, which started on the fourth floor, quickly spread throughout the entire building (4). The building was known to be a fire hazard and lacked proper safety measures (3). As a result, many residents were trapped and six people have been confirmed dead (5). There have been calls for resignation (1), and a public inquiry has been ordered by Prime Minister Theresa May (9). The incident has also sparked discussions on fire safety in other buildings (7). Donations are being accepted to help those affected by the fire (3).

Timeline.Text: At least six people die in a massive fire that engulfed the Grenfell Tower apartment building in London.
Theresa May orders a full public inquiry into the disaster at Grenfell Tower after 17 people are confirmed dead.
President Donald Trump visits the scene of the London fire and celebrates diversity in Britain.
A woman makes the drastic decision to jump from her apartment as the blaze continues to tear through the Grenfell Tower.
Bolton At Home expresses sympathy to those affected by the Grenfell Tower fire and reminds residents of fire safety in their own blocks.
Pressure grows on the leader of Kensington and Chelsea council to resign in the aftermath of the deadly Grenfell Tower fire.

Overview.Summary: The Grenfell Tower fire in North Kensington caused the deaths of at least six people and resulted in the evacuation of hundreds of residents (1,3,6,7). The fire was first reported at 12:54am on June 14 (6,8) and was thought to be caused by exterior improvements made on the building (9). This tragedy sparked calls for the leader of the Kensington and Chelsea council to resign (1). The Cardinal of Westminster also offered prayers for the victims of the fire (10). However, there were also reports of solidarity and support from the Muslim community during Ramadan (5,7).

Timeline.Text: A deadly fire breaks out in Grenfell Tower in North Kensington. The incident receives widespread media coverage.
Reports surface that the recent exterior improvements made on Grenfell Tower may have accelerated the spread of the fire.
Cardinal Vincent Nichols offers prayers for the victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

Overview.Summary: The fire at Grenfell Tower on June 14, 2017 (4,5), caused at least 12 deaths (9) and was treated as an "unprecedented" incident by emergency responders (8). The London Fire Brigade was one of the first on the scene (4) and urged the public to take care in the aftermath (10). The cause of the fire is still under investigation, but media reports suggest that the building's lack of fire safety measures, such as sprinklers, may have been a factor (10).

Timeline.Text: The 24-story Grenfell Tower in London is engulfed in a massive fire.
At least six people have died and over 70 are hospitalized as a result of the Grenfell Tower fire.

Overview.Summary: On June 16, a massive fire broke out in Grenfell Tower, a 24-story building in London (4). As of June 17, a death toll of 30 had been reported, with a possibility of further victims (3,6,7,8). An inquiry into the cladding used on the building has been ordered by the UK government in response to the fire (10). Metropolitan police have confirmed that the fire is being treated as a major incident (2). Donations and fundraisers have been set up to support the victims (3). A Kuwaiti businessman and a Syrian Imam were among those killed in the fire (9).

Timeline.Text: A fire breaks out at the Grenfell Tower in London while a local council chief resigns over the aftermath.
London Firefighters and police confirmed that the fire incident at Grenfell Tower was one of the deadliest in the history of London.
The mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, declares the incident at Grenfell Tower a national tragedy.
12 people die and more are presumed dead in the Grenfell Tower fire while an article reported disruptions in the lives of some people by the incident.
Police report that there were 79 people deceased or missing following the Grenfell tower fire incident.
Relief efforts increase as donations pour in to aid those affected by the Grenfell Tower fire incident.
Due to the damage to homes and fatalities caused by the Grenfell Tower fire, church leaders called for national debate on the state of the country.

Overview.Summary: The Grenfell Tower fire (10) caused significant delay in British Prime Minister Theresa May's power deal (2). Many questions emerged following the tragedy, including why May's chief of staff Gavin Barwell failed to review fire safety regulations (10). The fire also sparked criticism of May's aloof and robotic response (4) and calls for a public inquiry (7). The death toll was initially reported as 79 (3) and became a significant topic during the snap election (9). The BBC postponed a documentary on the fire (1) and Grenfell House is a topic of discussion on Carrie Fisher's death (1). The blaze further prompted Sadiq Khan to condemn fire advice given to Grenfell residents (8).

Timeline.Text: Theresa May deals with the aftermath of the Grenfell Tower fire, including criticism for her response.
The former housing minister Gavin Barwell, who failed to review fire safety regulations, becomes Theresa May's new chief of staff.
Simon Cowell organizes a benefit show for the victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.
A fire breaks out in Grenfell Tower in London, killing at least 79 people.
A documentary about the Grenfell Tower fire is postponed by the BBC.
Theresa May presents her plans for Brexit to EU leaders at a summit.

Overview.Summary: The Grenfell Tower fire on June 14, 2017 in West London (3) was a massive high-rise apartment fire that affected hundreds of residents (9). There is speculation that a faulty refrigerator may have caused the fire (6, 8). The incident has prompted a public inquiry into building safety and regulations (7, 10) and has raised concerns about the use of aluminum cladding in high-rise buildings (7).

Timeline.Text: A massive fire engulfs Grenfell Tower, a residential building in London, killing at least 79 people. One theory is that a faulty refrigerator may have caused the fire.
Details surface about the history of Grenfell Tower, including possible renovation loopholes, as the death toll continues to rise.
The UK orders an inquiry into the use of cladding after the Grenfell Tower fire.
Investigations reveal that the Grenfell Tower fire may have been caused by a faulty refrigerator.
Arcade Fire releases their album 'Everything Now', which includes a song about the Grenfell Tower fire.
Concerns are raised about the lack of fire safety regulations and possible exploitation of intellectual property rights in the aftermath of the Grenfell Tower fire.

Overview.Summary: The Grenfell Tower fire occurred on June 14, 2017 (4). It resulted in multiple deaths and a rise in community involvement and aid efforts (5,6). Concerns were raised about the safety of the building, which had been involved in a fire previously (2). The fire is believed to have started on the fourth floor and quickly spread (9,10). Some criticized the state's response to the disaster (8). Cladding used on the building may have contributed to its rapid spread (6). Following the fire, there were calls for the removal of the Bishop's Bench from the House of Lords (8). Amid the chaos and tragedy, stories of bravery and heroism emerged (1).

Timeline.Text: A massive fire engulfs Grenfell Tower in west London, leading to the death of at least 50 residents.
Residents and community leaders express their outrage over the inadequate response of the state to the devastating fire.
The Bishop of Gloucester calls for the removal of the Bishops' Bench from the House of Lords in light of the fire.
A man throws a baby out of a tenth floor window to save his life while the blaze rages on in Grenfell Tower.
The death toll in the Grenfell Tower fire rises to 62 as the search for more victims continues.
A vigil is held near the site of the London Grenfell Tower fire with numerous celebrities attending.
The Archbishop of Canterbury condemns the state's response to the fire as a failure of values.
Alec Marsh interviews Adele, who visited a vigil near the site of the fire in Grenfell Tower.

Overview.Summary: The Grenfell Tower fire (related to Grenfell Tower Inferno A Disaster Waiting To Happen article in these articles) occurred on June 14, 2017 and resulted in the death of 79 people (2). The fire spread quickly, causing concerns about building materials (4). The aftermath of the fire included potential health concerns for those exposed to the smoke (9). The fire sparked a number of investigations and criticism of building safety measures (10).

Timeline.Text: A massive fire engulfs the Grenfell Tower in London, resulting in at least 30 people taken to the hospital.
While the cause of the Grenfell Tower fire is still unknown, some reports indicate that it may have spread quickly due to construction materials used in the building.
An unidentified flying object is spotted in the sky above the burning Grenfell Tower.
During a report on the Grenfell Tower fire, a UFO is spotted in the background.

Overview.Summary: The Grenfell Tower fire (Event) was a tragic incident that occurred on June 14, 2017 and resulted in the deaths of six people (9). It involved a massive fire that engulfed the 24-story apartment building (9). The incident received condolences and support from various sources (8,10). A special audio tour was created for the church where residents could learn more about the building's history and the events that occurred (7). The incident spurred a call for action to end child hunger in the UK by the Church of Scotland (7). Another source stated that the fire resulted in 58 assumed deaths (2). Jamie Oliver, a well-known chef, also offered food and water to victims of the fire (1). Pope Francis also expressed sorrow for the victims (6).

Timeline.Text: A massive fire breaks out in the Grenfell Tower apartment building, killing at least 6 people.
Nigel Farage provides live updates on the Grenfell Tower fire.
Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver offers food and water to victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.
Misyon Online reports on Pope Francis' expression of sorrow for the victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.
The London police confirm that 58 people are assumed dead in the Grenfell Tower fire.
The Church of Scotland calls for action to end child hunger and a local residents' portal offers condolences and support for those affected by the Grenfell Tower fire.

Overview.Summary: The Grenfell Tower fire (12,1,14,20) occurred on June 14 and resulted in a large number of casualties and injuries (12,20,14). It was treated as a major incident (4,12,12), with 58 assumed dead (13). The fire was believed to be caused by a malfunctioning appliance and the building's lack of proper fire safety measures (7,2,19,6). Residents of the building had raised concerns about the safety of the building prior to the fire (18). The community and various organizations have gathered to provide support and assistance to the victims of the fire (15,17,8,9,20).

Timeline.Text: A fire engulfs the 24-floor Grenfell Tower in West London, resulting in multiple fatalities and injuries.
Residents are asked to shine torches and phones out of their windows to assist the fire brigade in their response to the Grenfell Tower fire.
British pop star Adele shows her support for victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.
Pope Francis expresses sympathy for victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.
A witness reports seeing a UFO in the sky above the Grenfell Tower during the fire.
